categories.title: Potty Routine
categories.description: Build spotless habits with predictable timing and clear communication.

items.title: Choose A Zone
items.summary: Pick one outdoor surface and leash-walk your puppy straight there for every break.
tips: Use the same cue word each time so the puppy pairs words with actions.
Reward in place before heading off to sniff—the party happens at the potty spot.

items.title: Track The Pattern
items.summary: Log wake-up, meals, naps, and accidents for three days to spot predictable windows.
tips: Set phone reminders 15 minutes after meals and play bursts.
If an accident occurs, shorten the next indoor window by 10 minutes.

categories.title: Crate Confidence
categories.description: Turn the crate into the chill zone your puppy runs toward.

items.title: Dine In The Den
items.summary: Feed every meal inside the crate with the door propped open for the first week.
tips: Scatter half the kibble to encourage sniffing and lingering.
Close the door for short bursts only after the puppy finishes calmly.

items.title: Breathe & Leave
items.summary: Practice stepping out of sight for 30 seconds while your puppy enjoys a lick mat.
tips: Return before whining escalates so confidence stays intact.
Mix up rooms so the crate isn't tied to only nighttime.

categories.title: Biting & Nipping
categories.description: Redirect shark teeth into thoughtful play.

items.title: Loaded Toy Station
items.summary: Keep three textures within reach (rope, rubber, fleece) to swap in instantly when teeth land on skin.
tips: Narrate 'take your toy' as you offer it so puppies learn the cue.
End the game for 20 seconds after two failed redirects to prevent escalation.

items.title: Calm Reset
items.summary: Guide puppies to a mat or crate for a chew whenever arousal spikes.
tips: Stay neutral—no scolding—so the break feels like guidance, not punishment.
Release once breathing slows and offer a calmer activity like a sniffy walk.

categories.title: Barking
categories.description: Lower the volume by meeting your puppy's needs before they shout.

items.title: Bark Journal
items.summary: Note the time, trigger, and recovery for each bark session to spot patterns.
tips: Look for energy mismatches—often barking follows long naps with no outlet.
Pair window coverings or white noise with treat scatters to preempt triggers.

items.title: Calm Interrupt
items.summary: Teach a quiet cue by rewarding a single breath between barks.
tips: Say quiet once, hold up a treat, and feed the moment barking pauses.
Practice when arousal is low before expecting it to work on doorbells.

categories.title: Chewing
categories.description: Offer legal outlets before table legs become toys.

items.title: Rotate The Buffet
items.summary: Swap chew textures daily so novelty stays high.
tips: Label bins 'squeak', 'rubber', 'edible' to remember variety.
Store chews out of reach so puppies only get them when supervised.

items.title: Chew Stations
items.summary: Place mats with tethered chews in each room where humans work.
tips: Clip a lightweight leash to the mat so puppies learn to stay nearby.
Refresh the chew every 10 minutes to keep interest high.

items.title: Mat Means Pay
items.summary: Cue puppies onto a mat before guests enter so they know where success happens.
tips: Feed three treats in a row for staying seated while the door opens.
If they pop up, reset by having the guest step back outside.

items.title: Turn & Re-Try
items.summary: Coach visitors to turn sideways and fold arms whenever paws leave the floor.
tips: Only resume petting when all paws land softly.
Pair with a hand-target cue so puppies have something else to do.

categories.title: Leash Skills
categories.description: Keep walks connected with games that reward slack lines.

items.title: Snack At The Seam
items.summary: Feed at your pant seam every few steps on new routes to remind puppies where you want them.
tips: Set a metronome on your phone to keep timing consistent.
Use scatter treats when they return voluntarily after mild pulling.

items.title: Surprise Turns
items.summary: Practice 180-degree turns indoors so puppies learn to follow and earn a reward.
tips: Say 'this way' before pivoting to give advance notice.
Praise the second they match your turn, even if you still need to lure.

items.title: Zoomie Plan
items.summary: Schedule play bursts right before predictable chaos (school pickup, guests).
tips: Pair tug + sniff walks so brains and bodies tire evenly.
Create a yes zone with hurdles or tunnels so wild energy has a job.

items.title: Calm Mat Recharge
items.summary: Teach puppies to settle on a mat with a stuffed chew after high-energy play.
tips: Use a specific blanket so the cue is portable.
Feed intermittently for staying down rather than for lying down.

categories.title: Alone Time
categories.description: Normalize solo moments so departures feel routine.

items.title: Separation Ladder
items.summary: Chart increasing durations (30s, 1m, 2m, 5m) and only climb when your puppy breezes through twice.
tips: Leave a camera rolling so you know the real comfort window.
Mix in false departures (keys, shoes on, no exit) to break patterns.

items.title: Exit Routine
items.summary: Create a predictable script: potty, chew pre-loaded, calm departure phrase, white-noise on.
tips: Keep arrivals equally calm so you don't spike adrenaline.
Swap chews halfway through via a helper if sessions exceed 30 minutes.
